Stop Saying if Starting Staying When

June 22, 2018

Author: Bianca Yang
Email: ipacifics@gmail.com

Frequently people phrase their desires as if-then statements. For example, they’ll say “If I have enough money, then I’ll buy a nice house in Beverly Hills”. I recommend that you start using “when”. For example, “When I get enough money, I’ll buy a nice house in Beverly Hills”. Prime your mind to get you closer to your goals, rather than leaving your goals as some distant possibility.
